repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->
Some updates after merging https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34849

comment_data.body: is it possible that `res.result` is `nil` from some "non compliant" servers or whatever? don't we still need to handle that? or is `vim.NIL` guaranteed
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

comment_data.body: I might be wrong but I believe we're the ones handling the `nil -> vim.NIL` conversion. Tagging @skewb1k to confirm.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

comment_data.body:
oh right, `vim.json.decode()` will set everything to `vim.NIL`. 👍 

I wonder if we should only do that for fields that are specified as `|null` in the spec? or that's how it works already?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

comment_data.body:
Hmm I'm not sure TBH. @skewb1k with your change do `nil` responses also get transformed to `vim.NIL`?
If not, then we need to revert this PR.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

comment_data.body: In https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a5c598871bcc16f1bc6fb8d46eb826d83d7d0f24/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/rpc.lua#L382-L383 we compare to `nil` but in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a5c598871bcc16f1bc6fb8d46eb826d83d7d0f24/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/rpc.lua#L425 we use `vim.NIL`, so I'm not sure what's the correct check.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

comment_data.body:
The reason the result 'null' is converted to nil is that, while the server conforms to the JSONRPC spec and responds with either a result or an error field, checking error first allows us to determine whether the response was successful. A nil value in the result field can then be interpreted as an empty result, rather than as the field being absent. Also, this behavior didn’t break any handlers prior to #34849.

I hadn’t fully appreciated the importance of this, but I now think these invariants in lsp.Handler parameters should be documented somewhere. Apologies for the confusion I caused, @MariaSolOs.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

@@ -809,7 +809,11 @@ function M.references(context, opts)
 
     for client_id, res in pairs(results) do
       local client = assert(lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id))
-      local items = util.locations_to_items(res.result or {}, client.offset_encoding)
+      local result = res.result
+      if result == vim.NIL then
+        result = {}

title: fix(lsp): compare to `vim.NIL` in `lsp/buf.lua`
